oiia.origin: Medial third of superior nuchal line; external occipital protuberance; nuchal ligament; spinous processes of C7–T12 vertebrae
oiia.insertion: Lateral third of clavicle; acromion and spine of scapula
oiia.innervation: Spinal accessory nerve (CN XI) and C3–C4 (sensory/proprioception)
oiia.action: Upper elevates; lower depresses; middle retracts; upper+lower rotate glenoid superiorly

oiia.origin: SPs of inferior 6 thoracic vertebrae; thoracolumbar fascia; iliac crest; inferior 3–4 ribs
oiia.insertion: Floor of intertubercular sulcus of humerus
oiia.action: Extends, adducts, and medially rotates humerus; raises body during climbing

oiia.origin: Posterior tubercles of TVPs C1–C4
oiia.insertion: Medial border of scapula superior to root of spine
oiia.action: Elevates scapula; rotates glenoid cavity inferiorly

oiia.origin: Nuchal ligament; SPs C7–T1
oiia.insertion: Smooth triangular area at medial end of scapular spine
oiia.action: Retracts scapula; rotates glenoid inferiorly; fixes scapula to thoracic wall

oiia.origin: SPs T2–T5
oiia.insertion: Medial border of scapula from level of spine to inferior angle
oiia.action: Retracts scapula; rotates glenoid inferiorly; fixes scapula to thoracic wall

oiia.origin: Clavicular head: anterior medial 1/2 clavicle; Sternocostal head: sternum, costal cartilages 1–6, external oblique aponeurosis
oiia.insertion: Lateral lip of intertubercular sulcus of humerus
oiia.action: Adducts & IR humerus; clavicular head flexes; sternocostal head extends from flexed

oiia.origin: Ribs 3–5 near costal cartilages
oiia.insertion: Medial border & superior surface of coracoid process
oiia.action: Stabilizes scapula by drawing it anterior & inferior against thorax

oiia.origin: Junction of 1st rib & its costal cartilage
oiia.insertion: Inferior surface of middle third of clavicle
oiia.action: Anchors & depresses clavicle

oiia.origin: External surfaces of lateral parts of ribs 1–8
oiia.insertion: Anterior surface of medial border of scapula
oiia.action: Protracts scapula; holds against thoracic wall; rotates scapula

oiia.origin: Lateral third of clavicle; acromion and spine of scapula
oiia.insertion: Deltoid tuberosity of humerus
oiia.action: Clavicular (anterior) part: flexes and medially rotates arm; Acromial (middle) part: abducts arm; Spinal (posterior) part: extends and laterally rotates arm

oiia.origin: Supraspinous fossa of scapula
oiia.insertion: Superior facet of greater tubercle of humerus
oiia.action: Initiates and assists deltoid in abduction of arm; acts with other rotator cuff muscles

oiia.origin: Infraspinous fossa of scapula
oiia.insertion: Middle facet of greater tubercle of humerus
oiia.action: Laterally rotates arm; acts with other rotator cuff muscles

oiia.origin: Middle part of lateral border of scapula
oiia.insertion: Inferior facet of greater tubercle of humerus
oiia.action: Laterally rotates arm; acts with other rotator cuff muscles

oiia.origin: Posterior surface of inferior angle of scapula
oiia.insertion: Medial lip of intertubercular sulcus of humerus
oiia.action: Adducts and medially rotates arm

oiia.origin: Subscapular fossa (most of anterior surface of scapula)
oiia.insertion: Lesser tubercle of humerus
oiia.innervation: Upper and lower subscapular nerves (C5, C6, C7)
oiia.action: Medially rotates arm; as part of rotator cuff, helps hold humeral head in glenoid cavity

oiia.origin: Short head: tip of coracoid process of scapula; Long head: supraglenoid tubercle of scapula
oiia.insertion: Tuberosity of radius and fascia of forearm via bicipital aponeurosis
oiia.action: Supinates forearm and, when supine, flexes forearm; short head resists dislocation of shoulder

oiia.origin: Tip of coracoid process of scapula
oiia.insertion: Middle third of medial surface of humerus
oiia.action: Helps flex and adduct arm; resists dislocation of shoulder

oiia.origin: Distal half of anterior surface of humerus
oiia.insertion: Coronoid process and tuberosity of ulna
oiia.innervation: Musculocutaneous nerve (C5, C6) and radial nerve (C5, C7)
oiia.action: Flexes forearm in all positions

oiia.origin: Long head: infraglenoid tubercle of scapula; Lateral head: posterior surface of humerus, superior to radial groove; Medial head: posterior surface of humerus, inferior to radial groove
oiia.insertion: Proximal end of olecranon of ulna and fascia of forearm
oiia.action: Chief extensor of forearm; long head resists dislocation of humerus; especially important during adduction

oiia.origin: Lateral epicondyle of humerus
oiia.insertion: Lateral surface of olecranon and superior part of posterior surface of ulna
oiia.action: Assists triceps in extending forearm; stabilizes elbow joint; may abduct ulna during pronation

oiia.origin: Ulnar head: coronoid process; Humeral head: medial epicondyle of humerus (common flexor origin)
oiia.insertion: Middle of convexity of lateral surface of radius
oiia.action: Pronates and flexes forearm at elbow

oiia.origin: Medial epicondyle of humerus (common flexor origin)
oiia.insertion: Base of 2nd metacarpal
oiia.action: Flexes and abducts hand at wrist

oiia.origin: Medial epicondyle of humerus (common flexor origin)
oiia.insertion: Distal half of flexor retinaculum and apex of palmar aponeurosis
oiia.action: Flexes hand at wrist and tenses palmar aponeurosis

oiia.origin: Humeral head: medial epicondyle of humerus; Ulnar head: olecranon and posterior border of ulna
oiia.insertion: Pisiform, hook of hamate, 5th metacarpal
oiia.action: Flexes and adducts hand at wrist

oiia.origin: Humero-ulnar head: medial epicondyle of humerus and coronoid process; Radial head: superior half of anterior border of radius
oiia.insertion: Shafts of middle phalanges of medial four digits
oiia.action: Flexes middle phalanges at proximal interphalangeal joints of middle four digits; more strongly, flexes proximal phalanges at metacarpophalangeal joints

oiia.origin: Proximal three quarters of medial and anterior surfaces of ulna and interosseous membrane
oiia.insertion: Medial part: bases of distal phalanges of 4th and 5th digits; Lateral part: bases of distal phalanges of 2nd and 3rd digits
oiia.innervation: Medial part: ulnar nerve (C8, T1); Lateral part: anterior interosseous nerve from median nerve (C8, T1)
oiia.action: Flexes distal phalanges 4 and 5 at distal interphalangeal joints (medial part); Flexes distal phalanges 2 and 3 at distal interphalangeal joints (lateral part)

oiia.origin: Anterior surface of radius and adjacent interosseous membrane
oiia.insertion: Base of distal phalanx of thumb
oiia.innervation: Anterior interosseous nerve, from median nerve (C8, T1)
oiia.action: Flexes phalanges of thumb

oiia.origin: Distal quarter of anterior surface of ulna
oiia.insertion: Distal quarter of anterior surface of radius
oiia.innervation: Anterior interosseous nerve, from median nerve (C8, T1)
oiia.action: Pronates forearm; deep fibers bind radius and ulna together

oiia.origin: Proximal two thirds of lateral supra-epicondylar ridge of humerus
oiia.insertion: Lateral surface of distal end of radius proximal to styloid process
oiia.action: Relatively weak flexion of forearm; maximal when forearm is in midpronated position

oiia.origin: Lateral supra-epicondylar ridge of humerus
oiia.insertion: Dorsal aspect of base of 2nd metacarpal
oiia.action: Extends and abducts hand at wrist; active during fist clenching

oiia.origin: Lateral epicondyle of humerus (common extensor origin)
oiia.insertion: Dorsal aspect of base of 3rd metacarpal
oiia.innervation: Deep branch of radial nerve (C7, C8)
oiia.action: Extends and abducts hand at wrist joint

oiia.origin: Lateral epicondyle of humerus (common extensor origin)
oiia.insertion: Extensor expansions of medial four digits
oiia.innervation: Deep branch of radial nerve (C7, C8)
oiia.action: Extends medial four digits primarily at MCP joints, secondarily at IP joints

oiia.origin: Lateral epicondyle of humerus (common extensor origin)
oiia.insertion: Extensor expansion of 5th digit
oiia.innervation: Deep branch of radial nerve (C7, C8)
oiia.action: Extends 5th digit primarily at MCP joint, secondarily at IP joint

oiia.origin: Lateral epicondyle of humerus; posterior border of ulna via shared aponeurosis
oiia.insertion: Dorsal aspect of base of 5th metacarpal
oiia.innervation: Deep branch of radial nerve (C7, C8)
oiia.action: Extends and adducts hand at wrist; active during fist clenching

oiia.origin: Lateral epicondyle of humerus; radial collateral and anular ligaments; supinator fossa; crest of ulna
oiia.insertion: Lateral, posterior, and anterior surfaces of proximal third of radius
oiia.innervation: Deep branch of radial nerve (C7, C8)
oiia.action: Supinates forearm; rotates radius to turn palm anteriorly or superiorly

oiia.origin: Posterior surface of distal third of ulna and interosseous membrane
oiia.insertion: Extensor expansion of 2nd digit
oiia.innervation: Posterior interosseous nerve (C7, C8), continuation of deep branch of radial nerve
oiia.action: Extends 2nd digit (enabling independent extension); helps extend hand at wrist

oiia.origin: Posterior surface of proximal halves of ulna, radius, and interosseous membrane
oiia.insertion: Base of 1st metacarpal
oiia.action: Abducts thumb and extends it at carpometacarpal joint

oiia.origin: Posterior surface of middle third of ulna and interosseous membrane
oiia.insertion: Dorsal aspect of base of distal phalanx of thumb
oiia.action: Extends distal phalanx of thumb at IP joint; extends MCP and CMC joints

oiia.origin: Posterior surface of distal third of radius and interosseous membrane
oiia.insertion: Dorsal aspect of base of proximal phalanx of thumb
oiia.action: Extends proximal phalanx of thumb at MCP joint; extends CMC joint

oiia.origin: Pisiform
oiia.insertion: Medial side of base of proximal phalanx of 5th digit
oiia.innervation: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8, T1)
oiia.action: Abducts 5th digit; assists in flexion of its proximal phalanx

oiia.origin: Hook of hamate and flexor retinaculum
oiia.insertion: Medial side of base of proximal phalanx of 5th digit
oiia.innervation: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8, T1)
oiia.action: Flexes proximal phalanx of 5th digit

oiia.origin: Hook of hamate and flexor retinaculum
oiia.insertion: Medial border of 5th metacarpal
oiia.innervation: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8, T1)
oiia.action: Draws 5th metacarpal anterior and rotates it, bringing 5th digit into opposition with thumb

oiia.origin: Flexor retinaculum and tubercles of scaphoid and trapezium
oiia.insertion: Lateral side of 1st metacarpal
oiia.innervation: Recurrent branch of median nerve (C8, T1)
oiia.action: To oppose thumb, it draws 1st metacarpal medially to center of palm and rotates it medially

oiia.origin: Flexor retinaculum and tubercles of scaphoid and trapezium
oiia.insertion: Lateral side of base of proximal phalanx of thumb
oiia.innervation: Recurrent branch of median nerve (C8, T1)
oiia.action: Abducts thumb; helps oppose it

oiia.origin: Flexor retinaculum and tubercles of scaphoid and trapezium
oiia.insertion: Lateral side of base of proximal phalanx of thumb
oiia.innervation: Recurrent branch of median nerve (C8, T1)
oiia.action: Flexes thumb

oiia.origin: 1st & 2nd: lateral two tendons of flexor digitorum profundus (unipennate); 3rd & 4th: medial three tendons of flexor digitorum profundus (bipennate)
oiia.insertion: Lateral sides of extensor expansions of 2nd–5th digits
oiia.innervation: 1st & 2nd: Median nerve (C8, T1); 3rd & 4th: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8, T1)
oiia.action: Flex metacarpophalangeal joints; extend interphalangeal joints of 2nd–5th digits

oiia.origin: Oblique head: Bases of 2nd and 3rd metacarpals, capitate, and adjacent carpals; Transverse head: Anterior surface of shaft of 3rd metacarpal
oiia.insertion: Medial side of base of proximal phalanx of thumb
oiia.innervation: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8, T1)
oiia.action: Adducts thumb toward lateral border of palm

oiia.origin: Adjacent sides of two metacarpals (as bipennate muscles)
oiia.insertion: Bases of proximal phalanges; extensor expansions of 2nd–4th digits
oiia.innervation: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8, T1)
oiia.action: Abduct 2nd–4th digits from axial line; act with lumbricals in flexing metacarpophalangeal joints and extending interphalangeal joints

oiia.origin: Palmar surfaces of 2nd, 4th, and 5th metacarpals (as unipennate muscles)
oiia.insertion: Bases of proximal phalanges; extensor expansions of 2nd, 4th, and 5th digits
oiia.innervation: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8, T1)
oiia.action: Adduct 2nd, 4th, and 5th digits toward axial line; assist lumbricals in flexing metacarpophalangeal joints and extending interphalangeal joints

oiia.origin: External surface of ilium between anterior and posterior gluteal lines
oiia.insertion: Lateral surface of greater trochanter of femur
oiia.action: Abduct and medially rotate hip joint; keep pelvis level when ipsilateral limb is weight bearing and advance opposite side during swing phase

oiia.origin: External surface of ilium between anterior and inferior gluteal lines
oiia.insertion: Anterior surface of greater trochanter of femur
oiia.action: Abduct and medially rotate hip joint; keep pelvis level when ipsilateral limb is weight bearing and advance opposite side during swing phase

oiia.origin: Anterior superior iliac spine; anterior part of iliac crest
oiia.insertion: Iliotibial tract, which attaches to lateral condyle of tibia
oiia.action: Abduct and medially rotate hip joint; keep pelvis level when ipsilateral limb is weight bearing and advance opposite side during swing phase

oiia.origin: Anterior surface of sacrum; sacrotuberous ligament
oiia.insertion: Superior border of greater trochanter of femur
oiia.innervation: Branches of anterior rami of S1 and S2
oiia.action: Laterally rotate extended hip joint and abduct hip joint when flexed; stabilize hip joint

oiia.origin: Pelvic surface of obturator membrane and surrounding bones
oiia.insertion: Medial surface of greater trochanter (trochanteric fossa) of femur
oiia.action: Laterally rotate extended hip joint and abduct hip joint when flexed; stabilize hip joint

oiia.origin: Superior: ischial spine; Inferior: ischial tuberosity
oiia.insertion: Medial surface of greater trochanter (trochanteric fossa) of femur
oiia.innervation: Superior gemellus: same nerve supply as obturator internus; Inferior gemellus: same nerve supply as quadratus femoris
oiia.action: Laterally rotate extended hip joint and abduct hip joint when flexed; stabilize hip joint

oiia.origin: Lateral border of ischial tuberosity
oiia.insertion: Quadrate tubercle on intertrochanteric crest of femur and area inferior to it
oiia.action: Laterally rotates hip joint; pulls femoral head into acetabulum to stabilize hip joint

oiia.origin: Superior ramus of pubis
oiia.insertion: Pectineal line of femur, just inferior to lesser trochanter
oiia.innervation: Femoral nerve (L2, L3); may receive a branch from obturator nerve
oiia.action: Adducts and slightly flexes hip joint; assists with lateral rotation

oiia.origin: Major: Sides of T12–L5 vertebrae and discs between them; transverse processes of all lumbar vertebrae. Minor: Sides of T12–L1 vertebrae and intervertebral discs
oiia.insertion: Major: Lesser trochanter of femur. Minor: Pectineal line and iliopubic eminence via iliopectineal arch
oiia.innervation: Major: Anterior rami of lumbar nerves (L1, L2, L3). Minor: Anterior rami of lumbar nerves (L1, L2)
oiia.action: Acts conjointly in flexion and lateral rotation of hip joint and in stabilizing this joint when standing

oiia.origin: Iliac crest, iliac fossa, ala of sacrum, and anterior sacro-iliac ligaments
oiia.insertion: Tendon of psoas major, lesser trochanter, and femur distal to it
oiia.action: Acts conjointly in flexion and lateral rotation of hip joint and in stabilizing this joint when standing

oiia.origin: Anterior superior iliac spine and superior part of notch inferior to it
oiia.insertion: Superior part of medial surface of tibia (as part of pes anserinus)
oiia.action: Flexes, abducts, and laterally rotates hip joint; flexes knee joint (medially rotates leg when knee joint is flexed)

oiia.origin: Anterior inferior iliac spine and ilium superior to acetabulum
oiia.insertion: Via common tendinous (quadriceps tendon) and independent attachments to base of patella; indirectly via patellar ligament to tibial tuberosity
oiia.action: Extends knee joint; rectus femoris also steadies hip joint and helps iliopsoas flex hip joint

oiia.origin: Greater trochanter and lateral lip of linea aspera of femur
oiia.insertion: Via common tendinous (quadriceps tendon) and independent attachments to base of patella; indirectly via patellar ligament to tibial tuberosity; also attaches to tibia and patella via aponeuroses (lateral patellar retinaculum)
oiia.action: Extends knee joint

oiia.origin: Intertrochanteric line and medial lip of linea aspera of femur
oiia.insertion: Via common tendinous (quadriceps tendon) and attachments to base of patella; indirectly via patellar ligament to tibial tuberosity; also attaches to tibia and patella via aponeuroses (medial patellar retinaculum)
oiia.action: Extends knee joint

oiia.origin: Anterior and lateral surfaces of shaft of femur
oiia.insertion: Via common tendinous (quadriceps tendon) and independent attachments to base of patella; indirectly via patellar ligament to tibial tuberosity
oiia.action: Extends knee joint

oiia.origin: Body of pubis inferior to pubic crest
oiia.insertion: Middle third of linea aspera of femur
oiia.innervation: Obturator nerve and branch of anterior division (L2, L3, L4)
oiia.action: Adducts hip joint

oiia.origin: Body and inferior ramus of pubis
oiia.insertion: Pectineal line and proximal part of linea aspera of femur
oiia.action: Adducts hip joint and, to some extent, flexes it

oiia.origin: Adductor part: inferior ramus of pubis and ramus of ischium; Hamstring part: ischial tuberosity
oiia.insertion: Adductor part: gluteal tuberosity, linea aspera, and medial supracondylar line; Hamstring part: adductor tubercle of femur
oiia.innervation: Adductor part: obturator nerve (L2, L3, L4) and branches of posterior division; Hamstring part: tibial part of sciatic nerve (L4)
oiia.action: Adducts hip joint; Adductor part: flexes hip joint; Hamstring part: extends hip joint

oiia.origin: Body and inferior ramus of pubis
oiia.insertion: Superior part of medial surface of tibia (as part of pes anserinus)
oiia.action: Adducts hip joint; flexes knee joint, medially rotating it when flexed

oiia.origin: Margins of obturator foramen and obturator membrane
oiia.insertion: Trochanteric fossa of femur
oiia.action: Laterally rotates hip joint; stabilizes hip joint

oiia.origin: Ischial tuberosity
oiia.insertion: Superior part of medial surface of tibia (as part of pes anserinus)
oiia.innervation: Tibial division of sciatic nerve part of tibia (L5, S1, S2)
oiia.action: Extends hip joint; flexes knee joint and medially rotates it when flexed. When hip and knee joints are flexed (as when sitting), helps extend trunk at hip joint (to rise).

oiia.origin: Ischial tuberosity
oiia.insertion: Posterior part of medial condyle of tibia. Reflected attachment forms oblique popliteal ligament (to lateral femoral condyle).
oiia.innervation: Tibial division of sciatic nerve part of tibia (L5, S1, S2)
oiia.action: Extends hip joint; flexes knee joint and medially rotates it when flexed. When hip and knee joints are flexed (as when sitting), helps extend trunk at hip joint (to rise).

oiia.origin: Long head: ischial tuberosity; Short head: linea aspera and lateral supracondylar line of femur
oiia.insertion: Lateral side of head of fibula. Tendon is split at this site by fibular collateral ligament of knee.
oiia.innervation: Long head: tibial division of sciatic nerve (L5, S1, S2); Short head: common fibular division of sciatic nerve (L5, S1, S2)
oiia.action: Flexes knee joint and laterally rotates it when flexed; long head extends hip joint (e.g., accelerating mass during first step of gait and when rising from sitting position).

oiia.origin: Lateral condyle and superior half of lateral surface of tibia and interosseous membrane
oiia.insertion: Medial and inferior surfaces of medial cuneiform and base of 1st metatarsal
oiia.action: Dorsiflexes ankle joint and inverts subtalar joint

oiia.origin: Lateral condyle of tibia and superior three quarters of medial surface of fibula and interosseous membrane
oiia.insertion: Middle and distal phalanges of lateral four digits
oiia.action: Extends lateral four digits and dorsiflexes ankle joint

oiia.origin: Middle part of anterior surface of fibula and interosseous membrane
oiia.insertion: Dorsal aspect of base of distal phalanx of great toe (hallux)
oiia.action: Extends great toe and dorsiflexes ankle joint

oiia.origin: Inferior third of anterior surface of fibula and interosseous membrane
oiia.insertion: Dorsum of base of 5th metatarsal
oiia.action: Dorsiflexes ankle joint and aids in eversion of subtalar joint

oiia.origin: Head and superior two thirds of lateral surface of fibula
oiia.insertion: Base of 1st metatarsal and medial cuneiform
oiia.action: Everts subtalar joint and weakly plantarflexes ankle joint

oiia.origin: Inferior two thirds of lateral surface of fibula
oiia.insertion: Dorsal surface of tuberosity on lateral side of base of 5th metatarsal
oiia.action: Everts subtalar joint and weakly plantarflexes ankle joint

oiia.origin: Lateral head: lateral aspect of lateral condyle of femur; Medial head: popliteal surface of femur superior to medial condyle
oiia.insertion: Posterior surface of calcaneus via calcaneal tendon
oiia.action: Plantarflexes ankle joint when knee joint is extended; raises heel during walking; flexes knee joint

oiia.origin: Posterior aspect of head and superior quarter of posterior surface of fibula; soleal line and middle third of medial border of tibia; tendinous arch extending between the bony attachments
oiia.insertion: Posterior surface of calcaneus via calcaneal tendon
oiia.action: Plantarflexes ankle joint independent of position of knee; stabilizes ankle joint

oiia.origin: Inferior end of lateral supracondylar line of femur; oblique popliteal ligament
oiia.insertion: Posterior surface of calcaneus via calcaneal tendon
oiia.action: Weakly assists gastrocnemius in plantarflexing ankle joint

oiia.origin: Lateral surface of lateral condyle of femur and lateral meniscus
oiia.insertion: Posterior surface of tibia superior to soleal line
oiia.action: Weakly flexes knee joint and unlocks it by rotating femur 5° on fixed tibia; medially rotates tibia of unplanted limb

oiia.origin: Inferior two thirds of posterior surface of fibula; inferior part of interosseous membrane
oiia.insertion: Base of distal phalanx of great toe (hallux)
oiia.action: Flexes great toe at all joints; weakly plantarflexes ankle joint; supports medial longitudinal arch of foot

oiia.origin: Medial part of posterior surface of tibia inferior to soleal line; by a broad tendon to fibula
oiia.insertion: Bases of distal phalanges of lateral four digits
oiia.action: Flexes lateral four digits; plantarflexes ankle joint; supports longitudinal arches of foot

oiia.origin: Interosseous membrane; posterior surface of tibia inferior to soleal line; posterior surface of fibula
oiia.insertion: Tuberosity of navicular, cuneiform, cuboid, and sustentaculum tali of calcaneus; bases of 2nd, 3rd, and 4th metatarsals
oiia.action: Plantarflexes ankle joint; inverts foot; maintains medial longitudinal arch
